page.title: 05A Stock Farm in Taddington
page.content: My father runs three farms as one unit;Beech Farm with 60 acres,Fold Farm with 100 and the rented 220 acres of Overwheal Farm.He has a herd of 100 Charolais and Hereford beef cattle which are kept inside from November to April and then fed on big bale silage, only the calves having feeding nuts as well.In the summer they eat only fresh grass.Stock are taken to Bakewell Market during the Autumn. He also has a flock of 290 ewes and 10 rams,mainly Mules and Suffolks with 500 lambs. These are kept outside all the time. Six weeks before lambing begins in April the ewes are fed corn.The newly lambed ewes are kept indoors for a few days until the lambs are strong enough to run with the flock.During the summer they are fattened on grass and sold during the Autumn again mainly at Bakewell Market.
